column1: WHITMORE ET AL. 2005 - MODERN POLLEN DATABASE FOR NORTH AMERICA AND GREENLAND
For details about this database, read this metadata sheet, also see the following publications:
When using this database, please cite the following references:

column2: Whitmore, J., K. Gajewski, M. Sawada, J.W. Williams, B. Shuman, P.J. Bartlein, T. Minckley, A.E. Viau, T. Webb III, S. Shafer, P. Anderson, L. Brubaker. (2005). Modern Pollen Data from North American and Greenland for Multi-scale Paleoenvironmental Applications. Quaternary Science Reviews 24: 1828-1848.

Williams, J. W., B. Shuman, P. J. Bartlein, J. Whitmore, K. Gajewski, M. Sawada, T. Minckley, S. Shafer, A. E. Viau, T. Webb, III, P. M. Anderson, L. B. Brubaker, C. Whitlock, and O. K. Davis. (2006). An Atlas of Pollen-Vegetation-Climate Relationships for the United States and Canada. American Association of Stratigraphic Palynologists Foundation, Dallas, TX.
.

column1: Questions or comments should be directed to:
2) Dr. K Gajewski, Laboratory for Paleoclimatology and Climatology, University of Ottawa, 60 University St, Ottawa, ON, K1N 7P5, Canada. Tel: 613.562.5800 ext.1057, email: gajewski@uottawa.ca
3) Dr. Jack Williams, Department of Geography, University of Wisconsin, 550 North Park St, Madison, WI 53706 , USA. Tel: 608-265-5537, email: jww@geography.wisc.edu.
4) For Climate and Bioclimate data: Dr. Patrick Bartlein, Department of Geography, University of Oregon, Eugene, OR 97403-1251, USA. Tel: 541.346.4967, email: bartlein@uoregon.edu
5) For AVHRR data: Dr. Jack Williams, Department of Geography, University of Wisconsin, 550 North Park St, Madison, WI 53706 , USA. Tel: 608-265-5537, email: jww@geography.wisc.edu.

This spreasheet contains five tables with the description of items in the following section of the modern pollen database : 
1) the pollen data; 2) the climatic and bioclimatic data; 3) the AVHRR data; and 4) Problematic sites that were flagged and removed from the database; 5) positional errors (see Whitmore et al. 2005), 6) east-west splits for selected taxa (see Williams et al. 2006 Atlas)

column10: DESCRIPTION

column14: Equivalent GPD individual moss polsters represented elswhere in BrownDB by averaged samples (ENUM#3483-3485) and recommended to use average.
column18: Unique sequential number for each record. Updates 17 April 2004.

column3: Unique key identifier for each entity.
column7: Unique key identifier for each entity.
column10: Unique key identifier for each entity.
column14: Depositional Environment (Atmospheric/Air, coastal, cave, estuarine, fluvial, other, pitcher plant, sand or snow origin under [DESCRENV] were dropped).

column3: Problematic sites. See "FLAG" tab in spreedsheet for legend
column7: mean monthly temperature (°C)
column10: Vegetation type (Biome) See Whitmore et al.2004, Figs 3 & 4. Reclassified biomes from Fedorova et al (1994)
column18: Site overlaps with ranges for western Abies species (see Thompson et al. 1999 Atlas)

column3: Samples with corrected geographic coordinates by B. Schuman and T. Minckley.
column7: mean monthly precipitation (mm)

column18: Site overlaps with ranges for eastern Acer species (see Thompson et al. 1999 Atlas)

column3: Original E number for GPD sites, -9999 for sites from other databases
column7: mean monthly percent possible sunshine (NOT clouds)
column10: Modal vegetation type from DISCover dataset V2, 21 x 21 km search window.  BATS classification scheme
column14: Site where NAP were not broken down into constituent taxa.
column18: Site overlaps with ranges for western Acer species (see Thompson et al. 1999 Atlas)

column3: Original Site number from GPD, Original MOD5SEQ number for sites from the Brown University Pollen Database,            -9999 for sites from other databases
column7: average annual temperature
column10: Modal vegetation type from DISCover dataset V2, 21 x 21 km search window.  Global Ecosystems classification scheme
column18: Site overlaps with ranges for eastern Alnus species (see Thompson et al. 1999 Atlas)

column3:
Original database source and sequence code for each record: The first characters specify the database from which a record originated.The numbers correspond to the unique sequential identifier of a record within the corresponding database origin.  -9999 indicates samples sent directly to us, rather than via a regional dataset.
(ABD=Anderson and Brubaker 1986, unpublished;BUPD=Brown University Pollen Database (Avizinis and Webb 1985); CPD=Canadian Pollen Database (Gajewski unpubl.); GPD=Global Pollen Database (Grimm 2000); KER=Kerwin 2000; MIN=Minckley 2002; SWUS=Davis 1995)
column7: absolute (all time over the period of record) maximum temperature (NOT average maximum monthly temperature)
column10: Modal vegetation type from DISCover dataset V2, 21 x 21 km search window.  North American Seasonal Land Cover classification scheme
column18: Site overlaps with ranges for western Alnus species (see Thompson et al. 1999 Atlas)

column7: absolute (all time over the period of record) minimum temperature (NOT average minimum monthly temperature)
column10: Modal vegetation type from DISCover dataset V2, 21 x 21 km search window.  USGS Level II classification scheme
column18: Site overlaps with ranges for eastern Celtis species (see Thompson et al. 1999 Atlas)

column3:
1) For samples obtained from other datasets, the first characters of the site code specify which dataset a record came from. The numbers correspond to the original sites code number of the record prior to duplicate removal to provide continuity.  For samples contributed directly to us, the first characters correspond to the initials of the contributing PI and the numbers were created by us.)
(Database codes:  AB=Anderson and Brubaker 1986, unpublished; BU=Brown University Pollen Dataset; G=Global Pollen Database;  K=Kerwin 2000; SW=Davis 1995. 
Data from the CPD were categorised by subdatasets within the CPD database: FRE=Fredskild 1973; GRE=Greenland dataset; LAC=Lacourse 1998; NQ=Northern Quebec dataset; WC=West Canadian Dataset; C=for all other Canadian Pollen Database samples; BON=Gajewski unpublished)  PI Initials:  ECG=Eric Grimm, KML=Kendra McLauchlan, STJ=Steve Jackson, GRW=Gene Wahl, and THD=Timme Donders.

column10: Modal vegetation type from DISCover dataset V2, 21 x 21 km search window.  SIB2 classification scheme
column18: Site overlaps with ranges for western Celtis species (see Thompson et al. 1999 Atlas)

column3: Site names from original datasets.  Site name from Webb is [Name1]+[Name2] fields

column3: Four character identifier for depositional environment for modern sample by K. Gajewski
Unique four character identifier for depositional environment for modern sample.
Descritption of depositional environment for the modern entity site (e.g. "Bog", "Lacustrine"...)
Two character code indicating the form of the data: RC=raw counts, RP=raw counts in percentages, DC=digitized counts, DP=digitized counts in percentages, PM=Counts in per mille
Depth of sample at location, when available.
Identifier for authors and year of publication.

Supplemental information (e.g. updates, problems) specific to record and/or Notes from Bryan Schuman (Geographic coordinates and Elevation correction) 2011 here means this is  CCR sample updated in 2011 (see update history)
